text:
- Hi, my name's Tim Sandage,
I'm a Senior Security Manager

for our Security and Compliance
Acceleration Program on AWS.
(upbeat music)
It's primarily built around
our AWS partners that are focused

on security and compliance
of AWS workloads.
and those partners and ourselves
help other partners and customers
get through highly regulated workloads.

So, like PCI, Payment
Card Industry standard
for protecting credit cards

or in the US federal government,
a program called FedRAMP.
It's always interesting to be able
to meet challenges around
how do you help secure various workloads?
It's really fun to be able to dissect
and help our partners and our customers
get through these challenges.

We have it broken down by
three major categories.

First, is kind of
healthcare and life science,

working with hospitals,
insurance companies,
anybody in the healthcare industry.
The second is financial services
in the financial services arena,
and then really public sector,

building security and compliant
workloads in the cloud

makes it much easier
to achieve and maintain

in that overall high-end
posture of security
as well as that compliance capability.
So, what a lot of our customers find out

when they switch to moving
regulated workloads to the cloud

is it becomes much easier
for them to operate,

because they have this
single pane of glass
that they can see at any given moment

throughout the life
cycle of their workload.
We have this thing called
Shared Responsibility Model on the cloud.

AWS does portions of managing
the cloud infrastructure

and managing the capabilities
for our customers
to be able to consume and use the cloud
in their customer accounts.

But then when they
build their own security

and compliance capability
inside the AWS customer account,

we aren't necessarily able
to be hands on with them.

And so, what we do is we
leverage our partner community.

That's what our program
is really built around
is those partners making sure

that we have the right partners
for the right regulations
and the right workloads to really
help our customers excel in this space.

One of the biggest
challenges for us within AWS,
especially as we started seeing the demand
for regulated workloads coming to AWS

was traditionally these
types of regulated workloads
take anywhere from 18 to 24 months
for somebody to achieve the outcome,

the security certification or
the accreditation on premise.
And so, that was the first step was
how do we reduce that timeframe.
Technology costs are technology costs,

but consulting costs are
usually based on billable hours.
If it takes me 18 to 24 months to do this
and the cost is x.
Now, the fact that we're able
to reduce that down to 9 or 10 months,

it's obviously reducing
that time and effort,
but it's really reducing the cost.
Everybody on my team now today
is all former practitioners of some sort.
We all have vast experience in this space.
And so, in a lot of cases,

we're doing a lot of what
I call free consulting.

We bring in a lot of breadth
and depth of experience
when we come in and start working
with our partners and our customers.

So that again, it goes
back to accelerating

how do the customers then
consume our services quicker,
and with more ease from a security
and compliance standpoint?
We at AWS can't do it all.
And our partners in a lot of cases
can't do it all by themselves,
but together, we're all better to be able

to deliver a stronger security
and compliance message.

And so, that's where we bring
all these partners together

to really create that
end-to-end security picture.

Maybe it's one partner
that's opened the door
to sell that solutions stack,
but the other partners benefit.
So, it's somewhat triples,
if not quadruples their sales force.
Our top priority is security,
but then the second piece is
how do we help elevate our partners
and make sure that they're
strengthening themselves in the market.

With our team, you can reach
out through our website
it's called ATO on AWS.

There's an intake form as
well as we have a email alias
ATOonAWS@amazon.com.
Both will come in everybody on my team,
you can submit a questionnaire
around the type of regulatory industry
that you're looking for,
whether it's FedRAMP, HIPAA, High Trust,
wherever the case may be.

And then we'll push that to the
various personnel on my team

that supports that industry
or supports that vertical.

And then you can also reach
out to your account team
or even your partner account managers.
They also know how to get a hold of us

so that we can give direct
support to the customers.
And there's a link to partners

and it has a full listing
of all the partners
that are on our program.
And it has detailed descriptions
of what their capabilities are.

It links back to their Amazon
partner network listing.

Gives more details of their
skills and capabilities.

Even in some cases, if they're
sold on AWS Marketplace,
you can go directly to Marketplace
where you can actually see what
their pricing models and so forth are.

Then it's just been an
amazing journey of seeing

all of the different
innovations and capabilities
that AWS has brought not only to AWS
and our customers and our partners,
but then programs such as those
that are focused on regulated workloads.

And we're really doubling
down on making sure

that we're able to support any
geography around the world.
(upbeat music)
